{"comments": {"id": 713, "count": 1502, "talk_id": 868}, "threadId": 713, "requested_language_english_name": "English", "current_talk": "868", "description": "Filmmaker Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy takes on a terrifying question: How does the Taliban convince children to become suicide bombers? Propaganda footage from a training camp is intercut with her interviews of young camp graduates. A shocking vision.", "event": "TED2010", "language": "en", "language_swap": false, "name": "Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy: Inside a school for suicide bombers", "slug": "sharmeen_obaid_chinoy_inside_a_school_for_suicide_bombers", "series_slug": null, "speakers": [{"id": "716", "slug": "sharmeen_obaid_chinoy", "is_published": true, "firstname": "Sharmeen", "lastname": "Obaid-Chinoy", "middleinitial": "", "title": "", "description": "Filmmaker, storyteller", "photo_url": "https://pe.tedcdn.com/images/ted/173374_254x191.jpg", "whatotherssay": "", "whotheyare": "Director and journalist Sharmeen Obaid-Chinmoy seeks to push people to have difficult conversations about inequality and injustice.", "whylisten": "

Sharmeen Obaid-Chinmoy writes: "'If a door hasn't opened for you, it's because you haven't kicked it hard enough' -- that is how I have lived my life. I am an accidental filmmaker, and picked up my first camera after graduating in economics and government. 

"I believe in the power of storytelling, and eliciting compassion and empathy by connecting audiences with people who have the courage to tell their stories. I traveled around the world shining a light on marginalized communities, refugees, women whose resilience in the face of adversity has inspired me to amplify their story."

inequality and injustice.", "whylisten": "

Sharmeen Obaid-Chinmoy writes: "'If a door hasn't opened for you, it's because you haven't kicked it hard enough' -- that is how I have lived my life. I am an accidental filmmaker, and picked up my first camera after graduating in economics and government. 

"I believe in the power of storytelling, and eliciting compassion and empathy by connecting audiences with people who have the courage to tell their stories. I traveled around the world shining a light on marginalized communities, refugees, women whose resilience in the face of adversity has inspired me to amplify their story."

title: Inside a school for suicide bombers
